variant.name: ChromeFailure
variant.summary: Some error in chrome caused the task to stop.

histogram.name: Actor.DomNodeGeometry.GetDomNodeResult
histogram.summary: The result of trying to resolve a DomNode's geometry. Recorded when PageTargets are converted.

histogram.name: Actor.Download.DirectDownloadTriggered
histogram.summary: Recorded when a direct download is triggered by an actor task.

histogram.name: Actor.Download.SaveAsDialogTriggered
histogram.summary: Recorded when a 'save as' download dialog is triggered by an actor task.

histogram.name: Actor.EventDispatcher.ComputedTargetResult
histogram.summary: The result of trying to convert a DomNode to a gfx::Point. Recorded when PageTargets are converted.

histogram.name: Actor.EventDispatcher.ModelPageTargetType
histogram.summary: The type of the PageTarget specified by the model. Recorded when PageTargets are converted from DomNode to gfx::Point.

histogram.name: Actor.EventDispatcher.{UiEvent}.Duration
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of time it takes for a UI event to complete.
Note that this metric is only recorded on clients on which a high-resolution clock is available.

histogram.name: Actor.EventDispatcher.{UiEvent}.Failure
histogram.summary: Recorded when a UI event fails.

histogram.name: Actor.ExecutionEngine.Action.ResultCode
histogram.summary: Recorded just before ActionResultCallback within ExecutionEngine. Reports the result codes of completed actions.

histogram.name: Actor.MayOriginGatePageTransition
histogram.summary: Records whether a page transition for a cross-origin navigation would have had origin gating, a safety feature which ensures the actor only interacts with trusted origins, is applied. We origin gate cross-origin client- initiated redirects and server redirects on the last link of the redirect chain.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.AllowListSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the allow list of origins which the actor can navigate to for the given task. These origins come from server actions or when a navigation confirmation request is granted. Recorded at the end of every task.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.AppliedGate
histogram.summary: Records whether navigation gating was applied when the actor tried to navigate the main frame. True means that gating was applied and the navigation was deferred until confirmation. False means the navigation was allowed to continue without gating. Recorded whenever the actor navigates the main frame.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.ConfirmedListSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the list of sensitive origins on the optimization guide blocklist that the user confirmed the actor can interact with. Recorded at the end of every task.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary: Records when actor navigation gating is applied to a cross-origin navigation. Recorded when the actor navigates the main frame and origin gating applies.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.CrossSite
histogram.summary: Records when actor navigation gating is applied to a cross-site navigation. Recorded when the actor navigates the main frame and origin gating applies.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.GatingDecision
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of actor navigation gating decisions. Recorded every time the actor attempts to navigate to a new URL and the origin gating feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.PermissionGranted
histogram.summary: Records when actor is given permission to continue navigating after navigation gating has already applied. Recorded when the browser receives the response from its confirmation request.

histogram.name: Actor.NavigationGating.TimeElapsedForGating
histogram.summary: Records how long origin gating processing is taking when it decides if an actor can navigate to a new origin. Recorded when the actor navigates the main frame.

histogram.name: Actor.ObservationDelay.DidNavigate
histogram.summary: Records whether the ObservationDelayController's DidStartNaigation() occurred. Recorded when the observation delay is completed.

histogram.name: Actor.ObservationDelay.DidTimeout
histogram.summary: Records whether the ObservationDelayController's Wait() timed out. Recorded when the observation delay is completed.

histogram.name: Actor.ObservationDelay.LcpDelayNeeded
histogram.summary: Records whether an additional delay was added by the ObservationDelayController because the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) had not yet occurred. Not recorded for timeouts.

histogram.name: Actor.ObservationDelay.StateDuration.{State}
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of {State} in the ObservationDelayController's state machine. Not recorded for timeouts.

histogram.name: Actor.ObservationDelay.TotalWaitDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the total time from when Wait() is called until the observation delay completes. Not recorded for timeouts.

histogram.name: Actor.PageContext.APC.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of fetching of the annotated page context for the PerformActions response.

histogram.name: Actor.PageContext.Screenshot.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of screenshot for the PerformActions response.

histogram.name: Actor.PageContext.TabCount
histogram.summary: Number of tabs to observe in PerformActions response.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the reason for page stability on renderer side. Recorded when the stability check is complete. Only recorded if NotifyWhenStable() is called.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.TimeFromMonitoringToNetworkAndMainThreadIdle
histogram.summary: The time from when active monitoring starts (kStartMonitoring state) until both the network and main thread are idle. This is recorded regardless of whether the overall stability check completes due to this condition or another. This provides an unbiased measurement for analyzing page quiescence performance. Not recorded when the stability check is aborted because the render frame was destroyed or timeout.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.TimeFromMonitoringToPaintStability
histogram.summary: The time from when active monitoring starts (kStartMonitoring state) until paint stability is reached. This is recorded regardless of whether the overall stability check completes due to this condition or another. This provides an unbiased measurement for analyzing paint stability performance. Not recorded when the stability check is aborted because the render frame was destroyed or timeout.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.TimeFromMonitoringToStable
histogram.summary: The time from when active monitoring starts (kStartMonitoring state) until the stability check completes (due to paint or network/main thread idle). Not recorded for timeouts or aborted checks (e.g., Mojo disconnection or the render frame destroyed). It excludes any initial, tool-specific delay.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.TotalTimeToRenderFrameGoingAway
histogram.summary: The total time from when NotifyWhenStable() is called until the stability check is aborted because the render frame was destroyed. This may be used to analyze the duration of checks interrupted by a cross-document navigation.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPageStability.TotalTimeToStable
histogram.summary: The total time from when NotifyWhenStable() is called until the stability check completes (due to paint or network/main thread idle). Not recorded for timeouts or aborted checks (e.g., Mojo disconnection or the render frame destroyed).

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPaintStability.SubsequentInteractionContentfulPaintCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of subsequent interaction contentful paints that occur during a single stability check. The count is recorded when the monitor is destroyed, e.g. when the render frame was destroyed or timeout.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPaintStability.TimeBetweenInteractionContentfulPaints
histogram.summary: The average time between interaction contentful paints since NotifyWhenStable() is called. A single sample, representing the average of all observed paint intervals, is recorded when the monitor is destroyed, e.g. when the render frame was destroyed or timeout.

histogram.name: Actor.RendererPaintStability.TimeToFirstInteractionContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time from when NotifyWhenStable() is called until the first interaction contentful paint occurs. Not recorded when the stability check is aborted because the render frame was destroyed or timeout.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Count.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the number of the actions in the task.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Created
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task is triggered for the first time. If the browser has actuation capability, this will be recorded as true, else it will be false.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Duration.NotVisible.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the total time the task was actuating while all of its controlled tabs are not visible (when tab contents are OCCLUDED or HIDDEN).
This excludes time spent in paused states.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Duration.Visible.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the total time the task was actuating while at least one of its controlled tabs is visible.
This excludes time spent in paused states.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Duration.WallClock.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the runtime of the task including any paused state.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Duration.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the runtime of the task excluding any paused state.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.Interruptions.{StoppedReason}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task is stopped with {StoppedReason}. This captures the number of times the task was interrupted.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.StateTransition.ActionCount.{OldState}_{NewState}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task makes a state transition from the old state ({OldState}) to the new state ({NewState}). This captures the number of actions the task made in the first state ({OldState}) before the transition.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.StateTransition.Duration.{ActorTaskState}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task makes a state transition. This captures the duration of time the task spent in the {ActorTaskState} state.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.StoppedReason
histogram.summary: The reason the task was stopped.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.SubsequentWaits
histogram.summary: Counts the total number of subsequent Waits per task. A subsequent wait is a solitary Wait action that follows a successful act sequence since the task was created or last resumed. Recorded once at the end of a task's life.

histogram.name: Actor.Task.SubsequentWaits.{ToolRequest}
histogram.summary: Counts the number of subsequent Waits that occurred after a specific tool per task. A subsequent wait is a solitary Wait action that follows a successful act sequence where {ToolRequest} was the last tool. Recorded once at the end of a task's life.

histogram.name: Actor.Tools.ExecutionDuration.{ToolRequest}
histogram.summary: The duration of how long a given tool took to execute when it was successful.

histogram.name: Actor.Tools.PageStabilization.{ToolRequest}
histogram.summary: The duration of how long a given tool took to stabilize after execution when it was successful.

histogram.name: Actor.Tools.TimeOfUseValidation
histogram.summary: The result of Time-Of-Check Time-Of-Use validation performed before a tool is invoked on a DOM element in a Web page.

histogram.name: Actor.Ui.TabController.Error
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error happens in the ActorUiTabController.

histogram.name: Actor.Ui.TaskNudge.Shown
histogram.summary: Recorded when a task nudge is shown.

histogram.name: Actor.UiTabController.NumberOfPendingCallbacks
histogram.summary: Reports the number of pending callbacks for async ui calls before the callbacks are invoked in ActorUiTabController.
